definition: earth/dust/clay/local/indigenous/crude opium/unsophisticated/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
sentences.chinese: 神把我扔在泥中，我就像塵土和爐灰一般。

sentences.english: The ground was covered with dirt with great wide ditches.
sentences.chinese: 地面上滿是塵土，而且有很寬的排污溝。

sentences.english: The sky glowed Saturday and a thin dusting of sand covered Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 北京週六天空灰濛濛的，到處是薄薄的揚沙塵土。

sentences.english: When all of war's dusts and clamours settle.
sentences.chinese: 戰場上的塵土已然蒼白。

sentences.english: He bent over to scrape some dirt off his shoes.
sentences.chinese: 他彎腰刮掉鞋子上的塵土。

sentences.english: There may be many earths, but there's only one Earthshaker.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有許多塵土，但只有一個撼地者。

sentences.english: It rained and the rain turned dust into mud.
sentences.chinese: 天下着雨，雨水把塵土變成了泥漿。

sentences.english: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.
sentences.chinese: 我縫麻布在我皮膚上，把我的角放在塵土中。

sentences.english: But you get up, brush yourself off and get on the saddle again.
sentences.chinese: 但是你又爬起來，撣去身上的塵土，再次爬上車座。

sentences.english: The way is long, and the dust is hot in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 道路是漫長的，烈日下路上的塵土火一般灼熱。

sentences.english: Dust-covered, the little boy doesn't cry.
sentences.chinese: 這個滿身塵土的小男孩並沒有哭。

sentences.english: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
sentences.chinese: 求你記念製造我如摶泥一般，你還要使我歸於塵土嗎？

sentences.english: The dust of the dead words clings to thee.
It's one of the most remote archipelagos in the world and receives very little dust.
sentences.chinese: 夏威夷羣島遠離大陸，因此塵土很少。

sentences.english: I brushed the sand and debris from my knees and forearms.
sentences.chinese: 我拂去膝頭和前臂上的塵土和瓦礫。

definition: to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
to flit across/to sweep past/to glance (strike at an angle)
